error.signature: Auto packing the repository in background for optimum performance. error: The last gc run reported the following. Please correct the root cause and remove .git/gc.log

verdict.summary: Automatic garbage collection failed and git wrote the error to .git/gc.log. Subsequent operations repeatedly print this warning until the gc.log is removed. Root cause is typically insufficient memory, disk space, or conflicting processes.

dead_ends.action: Simply deleting .git/gc.log without fixing the root cause
dead_ends.why_fails: The next auto-gc attempt will fail again and recreate gc.log with the same error, leading to an endless cycle of warnings

dead_ends.action: Disabling auto-gc entirely with git config gc.auto 0
dead_ends.why_fails: This prevents the error message but the repository grows unbounded with loose objects, degrading performance over time

workarounds.action: Fix the root cause, remove gc.log, then run gc manually
workarounds.how: Read .git/gc.log to identify the root cause. Free disk space or memory as needed. Remove .git/gc.log, then run git gc --auto or git gc manually to verify it completes.

workarounds.action: Run git gc with reduced memory settings
workarounds.how: rm .git/gc.log && git -c pack.threads=1 -c pack.windowMemory=100m gc. This limits memory usage so gc can complete on constrained systems.

leads_to.condition: when gc triggers pack-objects which exhausts available memory
when interrupted gc leaves broken object references

preceded_by.condition: when pack-objects OOM during gc causes the gc failure to be logged

frequently_confused_with.distinction: gc-auto-failed is the wrapper error about gc logging failures; pack-objects-died is the specific subprocess that failed within gc
